info.headline: Excessive Heat Watch issued August 22 at 4:49AM EDT until August 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, heat index values up to 108 expected. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with heat index values up to 112 possible and ambient temperatures up to 105. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama, northwest Florida and southeast Mississippi. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from noon today to 7 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Despite some uncertainty, some locations may approach all time record highs on Wednesday.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
